function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Universal application of EXPOSED to any pedestrian crowd models","Impact":"Increased risk of spreading contagious diseases across different types of pedestrian crowds","Mitigation":"Validation and calibration of the model for different crowd types and environments","Technologies":"Simulation and modeling tools for different crowd scenarios","People":"Policy makers, architects, designers, public health officials","Owner":"Researchers, public health organizations"},{"Description":"Use of EXPOSED to simulate people movement during pandemics","Impact":"Misinterpretation of simulation results leading to inappropriate policy decisions","Mitigation":"Validation of simulation results with real-world data and expert input","Technologies":"Data integration for real-world comparison, expert consultation","People":"Policy makers, public health officials, researchers","Owner":"Public health organizations, researchers"},{"Description":"Application of EXPOSED in informing building design and minimizing occupant exposure","Impact":"Ineffective building design leading to higher risk of disease transmission","Mitigation":"Peer review and validation of design recommendations by public health experts","Technologies":"Building simulation and design software, peer review platforms","People":"Architects, designers, public health officials","Owner":"Public health organizations, architectural firms"}]}
